intro: Baldingeria urens, commonly known as the small-flowered whitebeard, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Baldingeria urens is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
